*Have to sign 18 month commit letter for position, can't transfer anywhere.

*Have to work the sort a full year before applying to any RTD driver position and after you get a hernia lifting that 140lb BBQ grill you won't want to work here anymore, not even in RTD.

*Seniority system allows inexperienced new RTD drivers to be promoted over experienced proven long term drivers by seniority which is unsafe, hence all the accidents by newbies. seniority doesn't trump experience when driving a 80,000lb 53 ft semi truck but in this critical position they choose to be unsafe.

*OT sign up is by seniority and rotated so your selected once every 4-5 weeks for additional 4-5 hrs of OT.

*Part timers only get half the pay/ benefits as FTer's yet have to pay same amount for insurance and if you want additional coverage ADD+life etc. plan on losing a full paycheck per month to pay your insurance.

* If you have a family, a spouse, mortgage/rent/bills to pay stay away from FedEx Express, 20-25 hrs a week get you nowhere in the real world and when your kids say after church "daddy can we eat out today" the only place you can go is to McDonald's for a $1 spicy chicken sandwich cuz you'll be broke after you pay the rent/bills.

*wage freezes during economic hard times, last one lasted 5 years no raises for anyone! @2009-@2014

* If you want to drive trucks this is not the place to be, the astronomical turn over here should be a clear sign not to even think about FedEx Express, I was here for years so if I can help someone else avoid wasted years and no reward for hard work, good.
The pay is not great for what you have to do

Very disappointed at FedEx's health plan options. I expected more reasonable premiums and coverage options considering fedex is such a big, well known organization. HRA and HSA accounts are available; however The plans are not so great. The Company has many opportunities to improve its diversity, inclusion and equity practices. It has for years talked a good talk and some people have benefited; however, there's so much mileage left to be covered.

The Sourcing and Procurement org has serious leadership issues. Morale is low and has been consistently so over the years as reported on the annual survey that team members complete. Leadership micromanages everyone's work which leads to people not feeling like their leaders trust them to do a good job and nothing is ever good enough. They will also grill, berate and demoralize team members on the weekly update calls with stakeholders during the meeting! I've never seen anything like it in all my career. This has contributed to a very high turnover rate in the last few years. They also keep piling work on to the team members that are still here. Not only will you work on your project but you will take over those that quit as well. And the expectation to complete these projects are the same no matter if you have to work all day and into the night. They don't care. If you want to work at FedEx, look for roles in other organizations in the company.
